byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin and Alan Rappeport contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's camp is seeing his chances of winning 2016 Republican presidential nomination diminish following announcement of federal indictments in George Washington Bridge scandal.
lead_paragraph: As the federal indictments for the lane closings on the George Washington Bridge were announced, Gov. Chris Christie and his aides were reaching out to donors and supporters.

headline.main: Christie’s Camp Mobilizes to Salvage White House Hopes
headline.print_headline: Christie’s Camp Moves to Save White House Bid

snippet: As the federal indictments for the lane closings on the George Washington Bridge were announced, Gov. Chris Christie and his aides were reaching out to donors and supporters.
